p: The residual sugars were about 3 g/L, except for the kiwi-based drinks obtained with Cabernet Sauvignon must and fermented with T. delbrueckii ( Table 1). A higher content of residual sugars and a slower fermentation can have a positive impact on the aromatic profile [ 10]. The ethanol yield was comparable between T. delbrueckii and S. cerevisiae ( Table S2, Supplementary Materials); this is of interest for the production of quality wines where the former species could be used as a starter culture [ 11].
